snippet: The longtime Yankees announcer and former Baltimore slugger Ken Singleton says the current Orioles’ success actually began with their final game last year. But now the stakes are higher.
abstract: Harvey Araton On Baseball notes that longtime New York Yankees announcer and former Baltimore Orioles slugger Ken Singleton says the current Orioles' success began at the end of the 2011 season, but the stakes are higher in their division series against the Yankees.
lead_paragraph: The longtime Yankees announcer and former Baltimore slugger Ken Singleton says the current Orioles’ success actually began with their final game last year. But now the stakes are higher.

headline.seo: Orioles Face Longer Odds for Happy Ending This Season Ken Singleton, Yankees Announcer, Discusses Orioles, His Ex-Team
headline.main: Only One Way for Orioles to End This Season Happily
headline.print_headline: Only One Way for Orioles to End This Season Happily
